title: Low-Carb Thai Basil Turkey
description: A quick, aromatic stir-fry of lean ground turkey with Thai holy basil, bright lime, and savory-sweet sauce. Low in carbs and high in flavor, it comes together in under 30 minutes for an easy weeknight lunch or dinner served over leafy greens or cauliflower rice.

ingredients.notes: remove large stems; lightly chop or leave whole leaves

steps.text: Prep all ingredients: mince garlic, chop shallot, slice chilies and pepper, trim and halve green beans, measure fish sauce and coconut aminos, squeeze lime. Have basil leaves washed and dried.
Heat a large heavy skillet or wok over medium-high heat until very hot, then add neutral oil and swirl to coat the surface.
Add shallot and stir-fry for 30-45 seconds until fragrant and just beginning to soften, then add minced garlic and sliced chilies and stir for another 15-20 seconds without burning.

Add ground turkey, breaking it up with a spatula; spread into an even layer and let sear without stirring for 1 minute to develop browning, then continue to cook and stir for 3-4 minutes until mostly cooked through and no longer pink.

If using bell pepper or green beans, push turkey to one side and add vegetables to the hot side of the pan with a small splash of oil; stir-fry 2-3 minutes until crisp-tender, then combine with turkey.

Pour in fish sauce and coconut aminos, add sweetener if using, and stir thoroughly to deglaze the pan and evenly coat the turkey; simmer for 1-2 minutes to allow flavors to concentrate and moisture to reduce slightly.
Turn off direct heat, add lime juice, toasted sesame oil, black pepper, and most of the basil leaving a small handful for garnish; toss vigorously until basil wilts and is well distributed.

Taste and adjust seasoning with salt or additional fish sauce and lime as needed. Serve immediately over cauliflower rice or on a bed of leafy greens, topped with remaining fresh basil and lime wedges.
